Prepare data to plot Selection Frequency of planning units

Source: R/utils.R
splnr_get_selFreq.Rd

When multiple spatial plans are generated, we are often interested in how many times a planning unit is selected across an array of solutions. This array can either be a list of the solutions of different conservation problems or generated through a portfolio approach with prioritizr. splnr_get_selFreq() allows you to calculate the selection frequency of each planning unit of either a list or a portfolio of solutions. The resulting sf object can be passed for visualization to the spatialplanr function splnr_plot_selectionFreq().

Usage

splnr_get_selFreq(solnMany, type = "portfolio")

Arguments

solnMany

List or portfolio of prioritizr solutions

type

Either "portfolio" (sf object) with a portfolio produced using prioritizr or "list" with a list of solutions

Value

selFreq sf object containing a column with the selection frequency (sum over all solutions).

Examples

dat_problem <- prioritizr::problem(dat_species_bin %>% dplyr::mutate(Cost = runif(n = dim(.)[[1]])),
  features = c("Spp1", "Spp2", "Spp3", "Spp4", "Spp5"),
  cost_column = "Cost"
) %>%
  prioritizr::add_min_set_objective() %>%
  prioritizr::add_relative_targets(0.3) %>%
  prioritizr::add_binary_decisions() %>%
  prioritizr::add_default_solver(verbose = FALSE)

dat_soln <- dat_problem %>%
  prioritizr::solve.ConservationProblem()

# create conservation problem that contains a portfolio of solutions
dat_soln_portfolio <- dat_problem %>%
  prioritizr::add_cuts_portfolio(number_solutions = 5) %>%
  prioritizr::solve.ConservationProblem()

selFreq <- splnr_get_selFreq(solnMany = dat_soln_portfolio, type = "portfolio")
(splnr_plot_selectionFreq(selFreq))
